headline: Hospital Stocks Get Reprieve on Medicaid Spending, for Now
summary: Republican budget hawks blinked in their campaign to curtail Medicaid spending, and hospital chains led by  Universal Health Services  rallied on the news.  House Republicans late Sunday released their plan to reduce Medicaid spending’s growth, and it wasn’t as punitive to hospital operators as some feared.  The plan released by the House Energy and Commerce Committee includes a moratorium on new “provider taxes,” which are taxes in name only.

raw.headline: Hospital Stocks Get Reprieve on Medicaid Spending, for Now

The plan released by the House Energy and Commerce Committee includes a moratorium on new “provider taxes,” which are taxes in name only.

headline: 2 Safe-and-Steady Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 to Avoid
summary: A stock with low volatility can be reassuring, but it doesn’t always mean strong long-term performance. Investors who prioritize stability may miss out on higher-reward opportunities elsewhere.

raw.headline: 2 Safe-and-Steady Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 to Avoid
